title: Basketball Scores: Surprising Results
question_text:
Suppose Jane is interested in the total number of points scored in Division I NCAA college basketball games. She takes a look at several years of data and finds this distribution is approximately normal with a mean of $154\text{ points}$ and a standard deviation of $9\text{ points}$.
Would it be surprising to find a game where the total number of points scored is over $185$?

choices.text:
Yes, as the probability of this happening is between
5
%
and
10
%

Yes, as the probability of this happening is between
1
%
and
5
%

Yes, as the probability of this happening is less than
1
%

No, as the probability of this happening is between
10
%
and
30
%

No, as the probability of this happening is more than
30
%
